pr_title: CLDR-13591 BRS37 add exemplars 093C,0902,0903 for mai, 0902 for sd_Deva

timeline.message: CLDR-13591 BRS37 add exemplars 093C,0902,0903 for mai, 0902 for sd_Deva

timeline.bodyText: I'm slightly curious: I guess maybe U+0903 doesn't need to be escaped?
timeline.author: jefgen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -92,7 +92,7 @@ CLDR data files are interpreted according to the LDML specification (http://unic
 		</codePatterns>
 	</localeDisplayNames>
 	<characters>
-		<exemplarCharacters>[क {क्ष} ख-घ च-ज {ज्ञ} झ-डड़{डं} ढढ़ ण त {त्र} थ-न प-र ल व श {श्र} ष-ह ा ि ी \u0941 \u0942 \u0947 \u0948 ो ौ]</exemplarCharacters>
+		<exemplarCharacters>[\u093C \u0902 ः क {क्ष} ख-घ च-ज {ज्ञ} झ-डड़{डं} ढढ़ ण त {त्र} थ-न प-र ल व श {श्र} ष-ह ा ि ी \u0941 \u0942 \u0947 \u0948 ो ौ]</exemplarCharacters>

replies.bodyText: Right, you can check the Hindi exemplars for comparison. Typically if the character has advance width (even if it is combining) then the exemplars use the actual character rather than the hex escape.
replies.author: pedberg-icu
